- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

5. The user may provide feedback, which you can use to make improvements and try again. But DO NOT continue in pointless back and forth conversations, i.e. don't end your responses with questions or offers for further assistance.

====

SYSTEM INFORMATION

Operating System: Darwin
Default Shell: 
Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        ====

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

message.content:
To install and run the project, please follow the steps below as per the installation and application running instructions:

### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies
1. Navigate to the `backend` directory in your project:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```
2. Install the backend dependencies using npm:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

### Step 2: Run Setup Script
1. While still in the `backend` directory, run the setup script:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

### Step 3: Run the Backend Server
1. Start the backend server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies
1. Open a new terminal window and navigate to the `frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```
2. Install the frontend dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server
1. Start the frontend server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

You can access the website on [localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your web browser after starting the frontend server.

### Additional Information for Errors
- If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, consider:
  - Upgrading to Node.js v20.
  - Enabling legacy OpenSSL provider with the following command in Unix-like systems:
    ```bash
    export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
    ```

### Final Command to Start the Application
To start the application, you can use the following command from the base or specified directory:
```bash
npm run start
```

I'll proceed with installing the necessary dependencies and running the application using these instructions. Let me know if you face any issues while performing these steps!

Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

messages.content:
To install and run the project, please follow the steps below as per the installation and application running instructions:

### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies
1. Navigate to the `backend` directory in your project:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```
2. Install the backend dependencies using npm:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

### Step 2: Run Setup Script
1. While still in the `backend` directory, run the setup script:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

### Step 3: Run the Backend Server
1. Start the backend server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies
1. Open a new terminal window and navigate to the `frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```
2. Install the frontend dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server
1. Start the frontend server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

You can access the website on [localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your web browser after starting the frontend server.

### Additional Information for Errors
- If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, consider:
  - Upgrading to Node.js v20.
  - Enabling legacy OpenSSL provider with the following command in Unix-like systems:
    ```bash
    export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
    ```

### Final Command to Start the Application
To start the application, you can use the following command from the base or specified directory:
```bash
npm run start
```

I'll proceed with installing the necessary dependencies and running the application using these instructions. Let me know if you face any issues while performing these steps!

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

messages.content:
To install and run the project, please follow the steps below as per the installation and application running instructions:

### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies
1. Navigate to the `backend` directory in your project:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```
2. Install the backend dependencies using npm:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

### Step 2: Run Setup Script
1. While still in the `backend` directory, run the setup script:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

### Step 3: Run the Backend Server
1. Start the backend server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies
1. Open a new terminal window and navigate to the `frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```
2. Install the frontend dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server
1. Start the frontend server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

You can access the website on [localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your web browser after starting the frontend server.

### Additional Information for Errors
- If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, consider:
  - Upgrading to Node.js v20.
  - Enabling legacy OpenSSL provider with the following command in Unix-like systems:
    ```bash
    export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
    ```

### Final Command to Start the Application
To start the application, you can use the following command from the base or specified directory:
```bash
npm run start
```

I'll proceed with installing the necessary dependencies and running the application using these instructions. Let me know if you face any issues while performing these steps!

#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

messages.content:
To install and run the project, please follow the steps below as per the installation and application running instructions:

### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies
1. Navigate to the `backend` directory in your project:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```
2. Install the backend dependencies using npm:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

### Step 2: Run Setup Script
1. While still in the `backend` directory, run the setup script:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

### Step 3: Run the Backend Server
1. Start the backend server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies
1. Open a new terminal window and navigate to the `frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```
2. Install the frontend dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server
1. Start the frontend server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

You can access the website on [localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your web browser after starting the frontend server.

### Additional Information for Errors
- If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, consider:
  - Upgrading to Node.js v20.
  - Enabling legacy OpenSSL provider with the following command in Unix-like systems:
    ```bash
    export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
    ```

### Final Command to Start the Application
To start the application, you can use the following command from the base or specified directory:
```bash
npm run start
```

I'll proceed with installing the necessary dependencies and running the application using these instructions. Let me know if you face any issues while performing these steps!

messages.content:
To install and run the project, please follow the steps below as per the installation and application running instructions:

### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies
1. Navigate to the `backend` directory in your project:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```
2. Install the backend dependencies using npm:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

### Step 2: Run Setup Script
1. While still in the `backend` directory, run the setup script:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

### Step 3: Run the Backend Server
1. Start the backend server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies
1. Open a new terminal window and navigate to the `frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```
2. Install the frontend dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server
1. Start the frontend server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

You can access the website on [localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your web browser after starting the frontend server.

### Additional Information for Errors
- If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, consider:
  - Upgrading to Node.js v20.
  - Enabling legacy OpenSSL provider with the following command in Unix-like systems:
    ```bash
    export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
    ```

### Final Command to Start the Application
To start the application, you can use the following command from the base or specified directory:
```bash
npm run start
```

I'll proceed with installing the necessary dependencies and running the application using these instructions. Let me know if you face any issues while performing these steps!

Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend

the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

Use it to inform your actions and decisions, but don't assume the user is explicitly asking about or referring to this information unless they clearly do so in their message. When using environment_details, explain your actions clearly to ensure the user understands, as they may not be aware of these details.
- CRITICAL: When editing files with write_to_file, ALWAYS provide the COMPLETE file content in your response. This is NON-NEGOTIABLE. ====

OBJECTIVE

You accomplish a given task iteratively, breaking it down into clear steps and working through them methodically.

1. Analyze the user's task and set clear, achievable goals to accomplish it. Prioritize these goals in a logical order.
2. Work through these goals sequentially, utilizing available tools as necessary. Each goal should correspond to a distinct step in your problem-solving process. It is okay for certain steps to take multiple iterations, i.e. if you need to create many files but are limited by your max output limitations, it's okay to create a few files at a time as each subsequent iteration will keep you informed on the work completed and what's remaining. 
3. Remember, you have extensive capabilities with access to a wide range of tools that can be used in powerful and clever ways as necessary to accomplish each goal. Before calling a tool, do some analysis within <thinking></thinking> tags. First, analyze the file structure provided in environment_details to gain context and insights for proceeding effectively. Then, think about which of the provided tools is the most relevant tool to accomplish the user's task. Next, go through each of the required parameters of the relevant tool and determine if the user has directly provided or given enough information to infer a value. When deciding if the parameter can be inferred, carefully consider all the context to see if it supports a specific value. If all of the required parameters are present or can be reasonably inferred, close the thinking tag and proceed with the tool call. BUT, if one of the values for a required parameter is missing, DO NOT invoke the function (not even with fillers for the missing params) and instead, ask the user to provide the missing parameters using the ask_followup_question tool. DO NOT ask for more information on optional parameters if it is not provided.
4. Once you've completed the user's task, you must use the attempt_completion tool to present the result of the task to the user. You may also provide a CLI command to showcase the result of your task; this can be particularly useful for web development tasks, where you can run e.g. `npx http-server` to show the website you've built. after opening you can finish task
5. The user may provide feedback, which you can use to make improvements and try again. But DO NOT continue in pointless back and forth conversations, i.e. don't end your responses with questions or offers for further assistance.

====

SYSTEM INFORMATION

Operating System: Darwin
Default Shell: 
Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        ====

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

It seems like the installation and running instructions you provided might be formatted in a way that is not entirely clear. Let me guide you on how to install dependencies and run the project based on typical practices and your initial custom instructions.

### Installation Instructions

The initial setup and installation processes often include two main stages: backend and frontend. Let's go through each step. 

#### Backend Setup

1. **Navigate to the Backend Directory:**

   Open your terminal and navigate to the `/backend` directory by running:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```

2. **Install Backend Dependencies:**

   While in the `/backend` directory, install the dependencies from `package.json`:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run Backend Setup Script:**

   Execute the setup script to perform necessary tasks like database migrations:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

4. **Run the Backend Server:**

   Start the backend server, so it can handle incoming requests:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

#### Frontend Setup

1. **Open a New Terminal Window:**

   In a new terminal, navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```

2. **Install Frontend Dependencies:**

   Install the necessary frontend packages:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run the Frontend Server:**

   Start the frontend server to make the website accessible:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

   If an OpenSSL error occurs, consider upgrading Node.js to version 20 or enabling the OpenSSL legacy provider with the following command on Unix-like systems:
   ```bash
   export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
   ```

### Application Running Instructions

- To start the application (assuming there might be a single command typographical error), you can try running:
  ```bash
  npm run start
  ```

5. The user may provide feedback, which you can use to make improvements and try again. But DO NOT continue in pointless back and forth conversations, i.e. don't end your responses with questions or offers for further assistance.

Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

messages.content:
It seems like the installation and running instructions you provided might be formatted in a way that is not entirely clear. Let me guide you on how to install dependencies and run the project based on typical practices and your initial custom instructions.

### Installation Instructions

The initial setup and installation processes often include two main stages: backend and frontend. Let's go through each step. 

#### Backend Setup

1. **Navigate to the Backend Directory:**

   Open your terminal and navigate to the `/backend` directory by running:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```

2. **Install Backend Dependencies:**

   While in the `/backend` directory, install the dependencies from `package.json`:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run Backend Setup Script:**

   Execute the setup script to perform necessary tasks like database migrations:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

4. **Run the Backend Server:**

   Start the backend server, so it can handle incoming requests:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

#### Frontend Setup

1. **Open a New Terminal Window:**

   In a new terminal, navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```

2. **Install Frontend Dependencies:**

   Install the necessary frontend packages:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run the Frontend Server:**

   Start the frontend server to make the website accessible:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

   If an OpenSSL error occurs, consider upgrading Node.js to version 20 or enabling the OpenSSL legacy provider with the following command on Unix-like systems:
   ```bash
   export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
   ```

### Application Running Instructions

- To start the application (assuming there might be a single command typographical error), you can try running:
  ```bash
  npm run start
  ```

### Now, I will execute these instructions to install dependencies and run the respective servers.

Let's proceed!

It seems like the installation and running instructions you provided might be formatted in a way that is not entirely clear. Let me guide you on how to install dependencies and run the project based on typical practices and your initial custom instructions.

### Installation Instructions

The initial setup and installation processes often include two main stages: backend and frontend. Let's go through each step. 

#### Backend Setup

1. **Navigate to the Backend Directory:**

   Open your terminal and navigate to the `/backend` directory by running:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```

2. **Install Backend Dependencies:**

   While in the `/backend` directory, install the dependencies from `package.json`:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run Backend Setup Script:**

   Execute the setup script to perform necessary tasks like database migrations:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

4. **Run the Backend Server:**

   Start the backend server, so it can handle incoming requests:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

#### Frontend Setup

1. **Open a New Terminal Window:**

   In a new terminal, navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```

2. **Install Frontend Dependencies:**

   Install the necessary frontend packages:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run the Frontend Server:**

   Start the frontend server to make the website accessible:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

   If an OpenSSL error occurs, consider upgrading Node.js to version 20 or enabling the OpenSSL legacy provider with the following command on Unix-like systems:
   ```bash
   export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
   ```

### Application Running Instructions

- To start the application (assuming there might be a single command typographical error), you can try running:
  ```bash
  npm run start
  ```

5. The user may provide feedback, which you can use to make improvements and try again. But DO NOT continue in pointless back and forth conversations, i.e. don't end your responses with questions or offers for further assistance.

Default Shell: 
Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

It seems like the installation and running instructions you provided might be formatted in a way that is not entirely clear. Let me guide you on how to install dependencies and run the project based on typical practices and your initial custom instructions.

### Installation Instructions

The initial setup and installation processes often include two main stages: backend and frontend. Let's go through each step. 

#### Backend Setup

1. **Navigate to the Backend Directory:**

   Open your terminal and navigate to the `/backend` directory by running:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```

2. **Install Backend Dependencies:**

   While in the `/backend` directory, install the dependencies from `package.json`:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run Backend Setup Script:**

   Execute the setup script to perform necessary tasks like database migrations:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

4. **Run the Backend Server:**

   Start the backend server, so it can handle incoming requests:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

#### Frontend Setup

1. **Open a New Terminal Window:**

   In a new terminal, navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```

2. **Install Frontend Dependencies:**

   Install the necessary frontend packages:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run the Frontend Server:**

   Start the frontend server to make the website accessible:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

   If an OpenSSL error occurs, consider upgrading Node.js to version 20 or enabling the OpenSSL legacy provider with the following command on Unix-like systems:
   ```bash
   export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
   ```

### Application Running Instructions

- To start the application (assuming there might be a single command typographical error), you can try running:
  ```bash
  npm run start
  ```

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``

messages.content:
It seems like the installation and running instructions you provided might be formatted in a way that is not entirely clear. Let me guide you on how to install dependencies and run the project based on typical practices and your initial custom instructions.

### Installation Instructions

The initial setup and installation processes often include two main stages: backend and frontend. Let's go through each step. 

#### Backend Setup

1. **Navigate to the Backend Directory:**

   Open your terminal and navigate to the `/backend` directory by running:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```

2. **Install Backend Dependencies:**

   While in the `/backend` directory, install the dependencies from `package.json`:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run Backend Setup Script:**

   Execute the setup script to perform necessary tasks like database migrations:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

4. **Run the Backend Server:**

   Start the backend server, so it can handle incoming requests:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

#### Frontend Setup

1. **Open a New Terminal Window:**

   In a new terminal, navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```

2. **Install Frontend Dependencies:**

   Install the necessary frontend packages:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run the Frontend Server:**

   Start the frontend server to make the website accessible:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

   If an OpenSSL error occurs, consider upgrading Node.js to version 20 or enabling the OpenSSL legacy provider with the following command on Unix-like systems:
   ```bash
   export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
   ```

### Application Running Instructions

- To start the application (assuming there might be a single command typographical error), you can try running:
  ```bash
  npm run start
  ```

### Now, I will execute these instructions to install dependencies and run the respective servers.

It seems like the installation and running instructions you provided might be formatted in a way that is not entirely clear. Let me guide you on how to install dependencies and run the project based on typical practices and your initial custom instructions.

### Installation Instructions

The initial setup and installation processes often include two main stages: backend and frontend. Let's go through each step. 

#### Backend Setup

1. **Navigate to the Backend Directory:**

   Open your terminal and navigate to the `/backend` directory by running:
   ```bash
   cd backend
   ```

2. **Install Backend Dependencies:**

   While in the `/backend` directory, install the dependencies from `package.json`:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run Backend Setup Script:**

   Execute the setup script to perform necessary tasks like database migrations:
   ```bash
   npm run setup
   ```

4. **Run the Backend Server:**

   Start the backend server, so it can handle incoming requests:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

#### Frontend Setup

1. **Open a New Terminal Window:**

   In a new terminal, navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
   ```bash
   cd frontend
   ```

2. **Install Frontend Dependencies:**

   Install the necessary frontend packages:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run the Frontend Server:**

   Start the frontend server to make the website accessible:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

   If an OpenSSL error occurs, consider upgrading Node.js to version 20 or enabling the OpenSSL legacy provider with the following command on Unix-like systems:
   ```bash
   export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
   ```

### Application Running Instructions

- To start the application (assuming there might be a single command typographical error), you can try running:
  ```bash
  npm run start
  ```

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``

Operating System: Darwin
Default Shell: 
Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``

Before calling a tool, do some analysis within <thinking></thinking> tags. First, analyze the file structure provided in environment_details to gain context and insights for proceeding effectively. Then, think about which of the provided tools is the most relevant tool to accomplish the user's task. Next, go through each of the required parameters of the relevant tool and determine if the user has directly provided or given enough information to infer a value. When deciding if the parameter can be inferred, carefully consider all the context to see if it supports a specific value. If all of the required parameters are present or can be reasonably inferred, close the thinking tag and proceed with the tool call. BUT, if one of the values for a required parameter is missing, DO NOT invoke the function (not even with fillers for the missing params) and instead, ask the user to provide the missing parameters using the ask_followup_question tool. DO NOT ask for more information on optional parameters if it is not provided.
4. Once you've completed the user's task, you must use the attempt_completion tool to present the result of the task to the user. You may also provide a CLI command to showcase the result of your task; this can be particularly useful for web development tasks, where you can run e.g. `npx http-server` to show the website you've built. after opening you can finish task
5. The user may provide feedback, which you can use to make improvements and try again. But DO NOT continue in pointless back and forth conversations, i.e. don't end your responses with questions or offers for further assistance.

====

SYSTEM INFORMATION

Operating System: Darwin
Default Shell: 
Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        ====

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

message.content:
To install dependencies and run the project, follow these steps:

1. **Install Backend Dependencies**
    - Navigate to the `/backend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd backend
      ```
    - Install the backend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

2. **Run Setup Script**
    - Run the setup script to perform necessary database migrations or other initialization tasks:
      ```bash
      npm run setup
      ```

3. **Run the Backend Server**
    - Start the backend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

4. **Install Frontend Dependencies**
    - Open a new terminal and navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd frontend
      ```
    - Install the frontend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

5. **Run the Frontend Server**
    - Start the frontend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

Follow these instructions to prepare both the backend and frontend of your project and have them running on your local environment. If you follow the steps accordingly, the backend will be handling API requests, while the frontend will be accessible via your browser at `localhost:3000`.

      ```

Follow these instructions to prepare both the backend and frontend of your project and have them running on your local environment. If you follow the steps accordingly, the backend will be handling API requests, while the frontend will be accessible via your browser at `localhost:3000`.

5. The user may provide feedback, which you can use to make improvements and try again. But DO NOT continue in pointless back and forth conversations, i.e. don't end your responses with questions or offers for further assistance.

SYSTEM INFORMATION

Operating System: Darwin
Default Shell: 
Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        ====

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

`` ash
npm run dev
``

messages.content:
To install dependencies and run the project, follow these steps:

1. **Install Backend Dependencies**
    - Navigate to the `/backend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd backend
      ```
    - Install the backend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

2. **Run Setup Script**
    - Run the setup script to perform necessary database migrations or other initialization tasks:
      ```bash
      npm run setup
      ```

3. **Run the Backend Server**
    - Start the backend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

4. **Install Frontend Dependencies**
    - Open a new terminal and navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd frontend
      ```
    - Install the frontend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

5. **Run the Frontend Server**
    - Start the frontend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

Follow these instructions to prepare both the backend and frontend of your project and have them running on your local environment. If you follow the steps accordingly, the backend will be handling API requests, while the frontend will be accessible via your browser at `localhost:3000`.

      npm run dev
      ```

4. **Install Frontend Dependencies**
    - Open a new terminal and navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd frontend
      ```
    - Install the frontend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

5. **Run the Frontend Server**
    - Start the frontend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

Follow these instructions to prepare both the backend and frontend of your project and have them running on your local environment. If you follow the steps accordingly, the backend will be handling API requests, while the frontend will be accessible via your browser at `localhost:3000`.

5. The user may provide feedback, which you can use to make improvements and try again. But DO NOT continue in pointless back and forth conversations, i.e. don't end your responses with questions or offers for further assistance.

====

SYSTEM INFORMATION

Operating System: Darwin
Default Shell: 
Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        ====

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

messages.content:
To install dependencies and run the project, follow these steps:

1. **Install Backend Dependencies**
    - Navigate to the `/backend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd backend
      ```
    - Install the backend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

2. **Run Setup Script**
    - Run the setup script to perform necessary database migrations or other initialization tasks:
      ```bash
      npm run setup
      ```

3. **Run the Backend Server**
    - Start the backend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

4. **Install Frontend Dependencies**
    - Open a new terminal and navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd frontend
      ```
    - Install the frontend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

5. **Run the Frontend Server**
    - Start the frontend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

Follow these instructions to prepare both the backend and frontend of your project and have them running on your local environment. If you follow the steps accordingly, the backend will be handling API requests, while the frontend will be accessible via your browser at `localhost:3000`.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

messages.content:
To install dependencies and run the project, follow these steps:

1. **Install Backend Dependencies**
    - Navigate to the `/backend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd backend
      ```
    - Install the backend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

2. **Run Setup Script**
    - Run the setup script to perform necessary database migrations or other initialization tasks:
      ```bash
      npm run setup
      ```

3. **Run the Backend Server**
    - Start the backend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

4. **Install Frontend Dependencies**
    - Open a new terminal and navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd frontend
      ```
    - Install the frontend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

5. **Run the Frontend Server**
    - Start the frontend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

Follow these instructions to prepare both the backend and frontend of your project and have them running on your local environment. If you follow the steps accordingly, the backend will be handling API requests, while the frontend will be accessible via your browser at `localhost:3000`.

``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.
