messages.content:
To install dependencies and run the project, follow these steps:

1. **Install Backend Dependencies**
    - Navigate to the `/backend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd backend
      ```
    - Install the backend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

2. **Run Setup Script**
    - Run the setup script to perform necessary database migrations or other initialization tasks:
      ```bash
      npm run setup
      ```

3. **Run the Backend Server**
    - Start the backend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

4. **Install Frontend Dependencies**
    - Open a new terminal and navigate to the `/frontend` directory:
      ```bash
      cd frontend
      ```
    - Install the frontend dependencies:
      ```bash
      npm install
      ```

5. **Run the Frontend Server**
    - Start the frontend server:
      ```bash
      npm run dev
      ```

Follow these instructions to prepare both the backend and frontend of your project and have them running on your local environment. If you follow the steps accordingly, the backend will be handling API requests, while the frontend will be accessible via your browser at `localhost:3000`.

`` ash

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

5. The user may provide feedback, which you can use to make improvements and try again. But DO NOT continue in pointless back and forth conversations, i.e. don't end your responses with questions or offers for further assistance.

Operating System: Darwin
Default Shell: 
Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        ====

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider

- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"

Operating System: Darwin
Default Shell: 
Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        ====

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

5. The user may provide feedback, which you can use to make improvements and try again. But DO NOT continue in pointless back and forth conversations, i.e. don't end your responses with questions or offers for further assistance.

Operating System: Darwin

Home Directory: /Users/ravirawat
Current Working Directory: /Users/ravirawat/Documents/Arrowai/codebolt-agents/idurar-erp-crm

        USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS	

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``

        The following additional instructions are provided by the user. They should be followed and given precedence in case of conflicts with previous instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

### Step-by-Step Instructions:

1. **Install Backend Dependencies**:
   - Navigate to the `backend` directory.
   - Run `npm install` to install all backend dependencies.

2. **Run Backend Setup Script**:
   - While in the `backend` directory, execute `npm run setup` to perform necessary initializations.

3. **Start Backend Server**:
   - Still in the `backend` directory, run `npm run dev` to start the backend server.

4. **Install Frontend Dependencies**:
   - Open a new terminal window.
   - Navigate to the `frontend` directory.
   - Run `npm install` to install all frontend dependencies.

5. **Run Frontend Server**:
   - In the same terminal where frontend dependencies were installed, run `npm run dev` to start the frontend server.
   - If an OpenSSL error occurs, consider upgrading Node.js or enabling the legacy OpenSSL provider as per the detailed instructions.

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

The provided instructions seem to be incomplete. There are JSON elements or placeholders without specific details. However, based on the user's custom instructions, here's a detailed step-by-step plan to install dependencies and run both the backend and frontend servers of the project:

### Step-by-Step Instructions:

1. **Install Backend Dependencies**:
   - Navigate to the `backend` directory.
   - Run `npm install` to install all backend dependencies.

2. **Run Backend Setup Script**:
   - While in the `backend` directory, execute `npm run setup` to perform necessary initializations.

3. **Start Backend Server**:
   - Still in the `backend` directory, run `npm run dev` to start the backend server.

4. **Install Frontend Dependencies**:
   - Open a new terminal window.
   - Navigate to the `frontend` directory.
   - Run `npm install` to install all frontend dependencies.

5. **Run Frontend Server**:
   - In the same terminal where frontend dependencies were installed, run `npm run dev` to start the frontend server.
   - If an OpenSSL error occurs, consider upgrading Node.js or enabling the legacy OpenSSL provider as per the detailed instructions.

This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider

- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``

### Step-by-Step Instructions:

2. **Run Backend Setup Script**:
   - While in the `backend` directory, execute `npm run setup` to perform necessary initializations.

3. **Start Backend Server**:

5. **Run Frontend Server**:

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend
``
the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

`` ash
npm run dev
``

        #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies

In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory

`` ash
cd backend

the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:

`` ash
npm install
``
This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.

#### Step 2: Run Setup Script

While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:

`` ash
npm run setup
``
This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.

#### Step 3: Run the Backend Server

In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.

#### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies

Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:

`` ash
cd frontend
``
`` ash
npm install
``
#### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server

After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:

`` ash
npm run dev
``
This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.

:exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`

Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.


Try one of these and error will be solved

- > upgrade to Node.js v20.

- > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider

Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider

- On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)

`` ash
export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On Windows command prompt:

`` ash
set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider
``
- On PowerShell:

`` ash
$env:NODE_OPTIONS = "--openssl-legacy-provider"
``
Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider

After trying above solutions, run below command

`` ash
npm run dev
``
> If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.

### Step-by-Step Instructions:

1. **Install Backend Dependencies**:
   - Navigate to the `backend` directory.
   - Run `npm install` to install all backend dependencies.

2. **Run Backend Setup Script**:
   - While in the `backend` directory, execute `npm run setup` to perform necessary initializations.

3. **Start Backend Server**:
   - Still in the `backend` directory, run `npm run dev` to start the backend server.

4. **Install Frontend Dependencies**:
   - Open a new terminal window.
   - Navigate to the `frontend` directory.
   - Run `npm install` to install all frontend dependencies.

5. **Run Frontend Server**:
   - In the same terminal where frontend dependencies were installed, run `npm run dev` to start the frontend server.
   - If an OpenSSL error occurs, consider upgrading Node.js or enabling the legacy OpenSSL provider as per the detailed instructions.

It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.`

content.text:
<task>
To install dependencies and run this project, please follow the instructions below:

        Installation Instructions:
        ```
        [
  {
    "instruction": {
      "AIinstruction": "#### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies  In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory  ```bash cd backend ```  the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:  ```bash npm install ```  This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.  #### Step 2: Run Setup Script  While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:  ```bash npm run setup ```  This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.  #### Step 3: Run the Backend Server  In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:  ```bash npm run dev ```  This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.  #### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies  Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:  ```bash cd frontend ```  ```bash npm install ```  #### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server  After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:  ```bash npm run dev ```  This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.  :exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`  Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.   Try one of these and error will be solved  - > upgrade to Node.js v20.  - > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider  Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider  - On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)  ```bash export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider ```  - On Windows command prompt:  ```bash set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider ```  - On PowerShell:  ```bash $env:NODE_OPTIONS = \"--openssl-legacy-provider\" ```  Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider  After trying above solutions, run below command  ```bash npm run dev ```  > If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.`     "
    }
  }
]
        ```

        Application Running Instructions:
        ```
        "- shell:\n       command: npm run start"
        ```


        IMPORTANT: Please ensure to follow the instructions provided without deviation.
        
</task>

]

            #### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies  In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory  ```bash cd backend ```  the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:  ```bash npm install ```  This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.  #### Step 2: Run Setup Script  While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:  ```bash npm run setup ```  This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.  #### Step 3: Run the Backend Server  In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:  ```bash npm run dev ```  This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.  #### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies  Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:  ```bash cd frontend ```  ```bash npm install ```  #### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server  After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:  ```bash npm run dev ```  This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.  :exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`  Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub. content.text:
<task>
To install dependencies and run this project, please follow the instructions below:

        Installation Instructions:
        ```
        [
  {
    "instruction": {
      "AIinstruction": "#### Step 1: Install Backend Dependencies  In your terminal, navigate to the /backend directory  ```bash cd backend ```  the urn the following command to install the backend dependencies:  ```bash npm install ```  This command will install all the required packages specified in the package.json file.  #### Step 2: Run Setup Script  While still in the /backend directory of the project, execute the following command to run the setup script:  ```bash npm run setup ```  This setup script may perform necessary database migrations or any other initialization tasks required for the project.  #### Step 3: Run the Backend Server  In the same terminal, run the following command to start the backend server:  ```bash npm run dev ```  This command will start the backend server, and it will listen for incoming requests.  #### Step 4: Install Frontend Dependencies  Open a new terminal window , and run the following command to install the frontend dependencies:  ```bash cd frontend ```  ```bash npm install ```  #### Step 5: Run the Frontend Server  After installing the frontend dependencies, run the following command in the same terminal to start the frontend server:  ```bash npm run dev ```  This command will start the frontend server, and you'll be able to access the website on localhost:3000 in your web browser.  :exclamation: :warning:` If you encounter an OpenSSL error while running the frontend server, follow these additional steps:`  Reason behind error: This is caused by the node.js V17 compatible issues with OpenSSL, see [this](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40547) and [this](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532) issue on GitHub.   Try one of these and error will be solved  - > upgrade to Node.js v20.  - > Enable legacy OpenSSL provider  Here is how you can enable legacy OpenSSL provider  - On Unix-like (Linux, macOS, Git bash, etc.)  ```bash export NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider ```  - On Windows command prompt:  ```bash set NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider ```  - On PowerShell:  ```bash $env:NODE_OPTIONS = \"--openssl-legacy-provider\" ```  Here is [reference](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/14532#issuecomment-947012063) about enabling legacy OpenSSL provider  After trying above solutions, run below command  ```bash npm run dev ```  > If you still facing issue, then follow [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69692842/error-message-error0308010cdigital-envelope-routinesunsupported). It has so many different types of opinions. You definitely have solution after going through the thread.`     "
    }
  }
]
        ```

        Application Running Instructions:
        ```
        "- shell:\n       command: npm run start"
        ```


        IMPORTANT: Please ensure to follow the instructions provided without deviation.
        
</task>

]
